      • connected

        public boolean connected(L from,
                L to)
        Description copied from interface: DTGraph
        Checks whether two nodes exist with the given labels that are connected. If multiple pairs of nodes exist with these labels, only one of them needs to be connected for the method to return true.

      • state

        public long state()
        Description copied from interface: DTGraph
        The state of a graph indicates whether it has changed. If the value returned by this method has changed, then a modification has been made. If the value is the same, then with great likelihood, the graph has not been modified.
        Specified by:
        state in interface DGraph<L>
        Specified by:
        state in interface DTGraph<L,T>
